column4: Hi there. Anyone here that might help with a problem with dualbooting ubuntu/xp using grub2?
Ubuntu boots fine, XP just gives me the blinking cursor and I've been trying almost everything for 3 days now (almost nonstop)
XP is on sda2, ubuntu on sda1
hmm, blink cursor for XP, look like some XP issue...
No it isnt, since I tried a clone of it on a separate hdd as primary sda1 and it works
hmm, yes, that's exactly the microsoft problem, it wont boot on the second primary partition :))
Thanks, Captain Obvious ;-) But there has to be a solution regarding grub2
lol, there's an option in grub to remap partition, dont know if grub2 has it...
grub1 had map, grub2 has devicemap but i found only how to remap 2 different hdds
so the line in grub.cfg I tried was devicemap (hd0) (hd1) but imho that only would map harddisk 1 to harddisk 2
And I can't find any detailed information about devicemap anywhere ...
yep, I'm finding nothing here, too.
god, how i hate grub2 ... I would go back to grub if it weren't for burg
Actually, I can't since it's my 2nd pc and oh overjoy: my Main Monitor with 2 connectors went down the drain 5 days ago
So I would have to disconnect this pc, and reconnect the other one, booting, copying, pasting
